uk.ac.ed.bikerental

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.bikerental.Location

  • public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
    Location is a class that represents and stores the location of either a customer or a provider. A location object encapsulates the necessary location information to allow for comparisons of distance, a postcode and address. It is implemented as a small, independent class that can be utilised for many projects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Location(java.lang.String postcode, java.lang.String address)
      Creates a new location object with the given postcode and address, and will catch any postcodes that are more than 6 characters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(java.lang.String postcode,
                java.lang.String address)
        Creates a new location object with the given postcode and address, and will catch any postcodes that are more than 6 characters.

        postcode - The postcode of the location
        address - The address of the location

    • Method Detail

      • isNearTo

        public boolean isNearTo(Location other)
        Compares two locations by looking at their postcodes. We assume that two locations are nearby if the first two characters of their postcodes are equal, and return true if they are, or false if they are not.
        Parameters:
        other - The location we are comparing to.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of whether or not the locations are nearby each other.

        Returns:
        The postcode of the location.

        Returns the address of the location object.
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Implements the toString method for a location object. Useful for both debugging purposes, or for displaying a location in a simple format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string displaying the properties of the location object.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Implements the hashCode method for locations, allowing for them to be used in data types that rely on this function.
        Overrides:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implements the equals function for locations, allowing for direct comparisons between two location objects. Two locations are equal if they have the same address and postcode.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to compare to.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of whether or not the two objects are equal.
